Filter observations to restrict the maximum reporting delay

Source: R/preprocess.R
enw_filter_obs.Rd

Filter observations to restrict the maximum reporting delay

Usage

enw_filter_obs(obs, max_delay)

Arguments

obs

A data frame containing at least the following variables: reference date (index date of interest), report_date (report date for observations), confirm (cumulative observations by reference and report date), and group (as added by enw_assign_group()).

max_delay

Numeric defaults to 20. The maximum number of days to include in the delay distribution. Computation scales non-linearly with this setting so consider what maximum makes sense for your data carefully.

Value

A data frame filtered so that dates by report are less than or equal the reference date plus the maximum delay.

See also

Preprocessing functions enw_add_delay(), enw_add_max_reported(), enw_add_metaobs_features(), enw_assign_group(), enw_construct_data(), enw_extend_date(), enw_latest_data(), enw_metadata(), enw_new_reports(), enw_preprocess_data(), enw_reporting_triangle_to_long(), enw_reporting_triangle(), enw_retrospective_data()

Examples

obs <- enw_example("preprocessed")$obs[[1]]
enw_filter_obs(obs, max_delay = 2)
